title: Dow Jones Top Energy Headlines at 12 AM ET: Oil Futures Fall As Market Looks to U.S.-Russia Summit
content:
Oil Futures Fall As Market Looks to U.S.-Russia Summit

Oil futures settled lower in light trading with the market's main focus this week on Friday's meeting between Presidents Trump and Putin.

Venture Global's Michael Sabel and Robert Pender fend off challenge that hung over the company's future.

OPEC Lifts 2026 Oil Demand View as It Continues to Boost Output

The raised forecast comes as the global economy was now projected to grow 3% this year, up from 2.9% previously.

Venture Global logged higher profit and more than doubled its revenue in its latest quarter as liquefied natural gas sales volumes rose.

Orsted Shares Tumble After Halting of U.S. Wind Project Sale; $9.4 Billion Rights Issue Proposal

The decision to stop the sale comes after developments in the U.S. wind market disrupted the renewable-energy company's asset sale plans.

General Electric and United Nuclear Agree to Cleanup of Uranium Mine Waste

General Electric and United Nuclear have agreed to a U.S. consent decree requiring an estimated $63 million cleanup of uranium mine waste at sites in New Mexico and the Navajo Nation.

Find insight on crude futures, Orsted, Woodside Energy and more in the latest Market Talks covering Energy and Utilities.

Vistra sees electricity demand trending like it's the 1990s, fueled by AI and crypto

Vistra Corp.'s stock rose Thursday after the power company lifted its estimate for potential profitability next year, citing the rising demand for electricity to power data centers used for artificial intelligence and the mining of cryptocurrencies.

ConocoPhillips's second-quarter earnings fell, hurt by lower prices that were slightly offset by higher production.

The transaction paves the way for Genstar Capital and Hellman & Friedman to exit stakes in the energy data intelligence company.

U.S. crude oil inventories fell by 3 million barrels last week as imports dropped, exports rose, and refineries raised their capacity use.

The Abu Dhabi-owned gas company said net profit for the quarter rose 16% on the same period a year prior, setting a fresh quarterly record.
summary: Oil futures fell in light trading as the focus of the U.S.-Russia Summit was on Friday. OPEC has increased its 2026 oil demand forecast, with the global economy now projected to grow by 3% this year, up from 2.9% previously. Venture Global reported a higher profit and more than doubled its revenue in its latest quarter as liquefied natural gas sales volumes increased. Orsted shares fell after the company halted a U.K. wind project sale due to developments in the U.,S. wind market. General Electric and United Nuclear have agreed to a U.,N. consent decree for an estimated $63 million cleanup of uranium mine waste at sites in New Mexico and the Navajo Nation.
shortSummary: Oil Futures fell as investors focused on the upcoming US-Russia summit, with notable gains in Vistra Corp's stock and Orsted's decline.
argos_summary: Oil futures declined as attention shifts to the upcoming U.S.-Russia summit. OPEC has raised its 2026 oil demand forecast amid a projected global economic growth of 3%. Venture Global reported a significant increase in profits and revenue due to rising liquefied natural gas sales. Additionally, Orsted's shares fell after halting a U.S. wind project sale, while General Electric and United Nuclear agreed to a $63 million cleanup of uranium mine waste.
